Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory427.jpg'}
{1: 'World Government', 2: 'Punishing Defense Command Center'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hans', 3: 'Report the losses...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After losing contact with the space forces, the command center immediately dispatched an aerospace squadron to investigate.'}
{3: 'But soon, falling debris forced them to alter their original plan.'}
{3: 'To clear a path between ground and sky, the military had to destroy most infected defensive formations from previous operations.'}
{3: 'With air raid alarms sounding from all directions, they had to consolidate their limited aerial forces to intercept the debris, preventing further damage to ground facilities and civilians.'}
{3: 'Such losses are expected but unavoidable.'}
{3: "When the sky was covered in smoke and no more burning debris fell, the command center finally received warnings from Ballard's team and saw the liaison sent by the spaceport."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Yes... As of now, the reported losses from the space forces are as follows.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Space station: 1,927 dead, 25 survivors. The station is fully occupied, with a 0.12% chance of reclaiming it.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Starship Fleet: 35,782 dead, 965 missing, 1,729 survivors. All officers above the deputy command level are dead, with an 87% combat unit casualty rate and complete ship destruction.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Spaceport garrison: 1,792 dead, 298 missing, 23,597 survivors. The smallest loss, with remaining modular sections detached and docked with Eden II colony ship.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Aerospace squadron: 9,300 dead, 125 missing, over 80% personnel casualty rate, and over 97% aircraft loss rate.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Additionally, losses from radiation and falling debris caused by the space nuclear explosion are still being assessed...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Any other news?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lieutenant', 3: "Gestalt's central core has been dismantled and is on its way.", 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "Have the tech department draft an isolation plan immediately. We must make sure this doesn't happen again.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'And... the report from Reactor One.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Thirty minutes ago, our 45 monitoring stations simultaneously detected a spike in Punishing concentration in the area.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Within 300 milliseconds, it rose to 20,000 times the original level, and we lost contact with Dominik and his team.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Did they fail too...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'No... The command staff thinks they succeeded.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Because in the following 30 minutes, there were no further increases in Punishing concentration, and it is now spreading according to our diffusion model.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Most importantly, no energy reactions were detected in the area after the burst.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'The command staff ruled out all other possibilities, so we can infer that Reactor 1 has been shut down.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Lieutenant', 3: 'Commander, what should we do next?', 4: '2'}
{3: 'Although the chaos has subsided, this is not the end. This is not even the beginning of the end, but merely the end of the beginning.'}
{3: 'With the loss of the spaceport, starships, and the International Space Station, Project Acadia Transfer has completely failed.'}
{3: 'While soldiers and civilians mourn their lost comrades and loved ones, decision-makers must step forward to carve a new future.'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'First, establish quarantine zones and evacuate the masses based on the diffusion situation.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Dispatch rescue teams, determine the Geiger index in nuclear-affected areas, plan safe areas, conduct cleanup, and restart power facilities.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Compile accurate casualty numbers and reorganize the surviving units.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Go and finish these tasks first.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'After issuing the orders, Hans stands up and walks out of the command center.'}
{3: 'The nearby guard immediately follows him, but Hans waves him off.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Hans', 3: "There's no security risk here. Leave me alone for a while.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He slowly walks outside. Even this steadfast pine tree has bent slightly.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory46.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: "Hans sits alone in the room. He hasn't been back here or slept for days while directing the operation."}
{3: 'He had considered the worst-case scenario, but they still knew too little about the Punishing.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'Unimaginable situations led to unbearable losses.'}
{3: 'He wants to keep thinking, but fatigue and guilt are dragging his mind to the edge of chaos.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory843.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory843.jpg'}
{3: 'What should we do?'}
{3: 'He is a soldier, a commander, with duties and beliefs.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory845.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory845.jpg'}
{3: 'But he is also a human with flesh and blood who is unable to ignore the bloodshed behind the numbers in the reports.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory846.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory846.jpg'}
{3: 'Did he make a mistake? He keeps questioning himself after leaving the command room.'}
{3: 'Would different plans or even just adjusting the sequence have led to better outcomes?'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory847.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory847.jpg'}
{3: 'They have sworn to pave the way to victory for humanity with their flesh and blood.'}
{3: "But that doesn't mean paving the path to victory with sacrifices is the right thing to do."}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory848.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory848.jpg'}
{3: 'What should he do next? How should he face the survivors?'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory844.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory844.jpg'}
{3: 'The weighty burdens press upon his shoulders, menacing to fracture this resolute pine tree.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory849.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory850.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory851.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory852.jpg'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory853.jpg'}
{3: 'Want to be free?'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory0.png'}
{3: 'He opens the cabinet beside the desk, revealing a fully loaded pistol.'}
{3: 'He presses the gun against his chin.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{3: 'Meanwhile, an "old friend" shows up at Trillard\'s residence.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Trillard', 3: "I'm guessing you didn't drop by at a time like this just for a casual catch-up, am I right?", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He nudges the cup of steaming tea toward the other side and sits back on the couch.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'How should I address you, Kurono-San?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'That suits me just fine.'}
{3: 'The other person takes the cup, giving it a gentle swirl, causing the amber tea to ripple softly within the ceramic vessel.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "After over thirty years of knowing each other, can't you serve me some better tea?"}
{3: "The person's tone carries a playful demeanor, devoid of any sense of distance, as if talking to a familiar friend whom they frequently visit."}
{3: 'Trillard wears a resigned expression, with a subtle undertone of teasing complaint in his voice.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Unlike you, the big-shot entrepreneur swimming in cash, I only have my salary from the World Government to rely on.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "It's been ages since you last visited me. Many things have happened, you know.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The two cunning old foxes exchange knowing smiles.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Since it's a long-awaited reunion, are you here to reminisce about the good old days?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Let me guess. Is it "Project Cthylla" or "Winter"?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The person lightly taps the handle of the teacup with a finger.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Forget about that little business in the past. Not even worth mentioning anymore.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Oh, so you really don't know?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Want me to fill you in on some inside information?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The person places the teacup on the coaster and falls silent.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "That's against the rules, isn't it? I don't want to end up in hot water, you know."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Do you really care about all that?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "I'm a law-abiding taxpayer."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'If you say so.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Trillard takes a sip of tea and then gently puts the cup down.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Well, if there's nothing else to catch up on, excuse me, but I've got a lot on my plate right now.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Oh, really? Hasn't the military taken over the World Government's command since the outbreak of the Punishing Virus?"}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "You haven't made a public appearance in a while as the President of the World Government, right?"}
{3: "The seemingly casual words slither into Trillard's heart, much like a snake's tongue."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "It's a special time, after all. Signing documents is more than enough for me. My old bones can't handle the front lines anymore.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'The person sitting opposite lets out a chuckle.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Of course, signing documents is also a very important job.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Just like fighting the Punishing Virus, maintaining government operations and ensuring people's lives aren't a walk in the park."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'But you and I both know, the more ordinary the task, the more easily it gets overlooked. People tend to remember the changes you made, not the things you maintained.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'While they mourn the sacrifices of soldiers, how many actually remember those who toil for their daily necessities?'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Even though the latter is closely related to their lives.'}
{3: 'Among the seemingly ordinary words, lay the most venomous and contemptuous provocation.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Everyone has their role to play. For us, staying behind the scenes is the best outcome.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Moreover, Hans is my friend. I've placed all my trust in him.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Oh, come on, my friend, cut it out with the old jokes.'}
{3: 'The person speaks in a pretentious tone.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'People like us only trust ourselves and established facts.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "What if we're not the same?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Is this your way of showing humor?'}
{3: 'Trillard offers no response.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'For us, words are just a curtain covering our true intentions.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "What we say never matters; it's our actions that truly reveal our hearts."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'If you truly didn\'t care, you wouldn\'t be so eagerly pushing for "Project Eden" or implementing the "Hiring Act" to secure your re-election.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'For that, we are all grateful.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Does "we" refer to the Kurono Group, or...', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Before Trillard continues, the person interrupts him.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'The Group and its friends, of course.'}
{3: "Observing Trillard's silence, Kurono-San nods in satisfaction."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'You went all-in on "Project Eden", but unfortunately, it seems like you made the wrong bet.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Like I said, people remember what you changed, not what you maintained.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Medical reform? Civilianizing Gestalt? Universalizing education?'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "You're wrong, my friend. They won't remember any of those."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "They'll only remember that the first President of the World Government and the Science Council opened the gates of hell, unleashing the disaster known as the Punishing Virus."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "They might not have had the time to settle scores yet, but I'm guessing you've already suppressed quite a few impeachments against the Science Council, right?"}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Even humanity's once shining beacon of hope can be engulfed by such foolish opinions. What chance do you stand?"}
{3: 'Trillard remains silent, not directly refuting the other.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Expecting rationality from people in the face of calamity is a luxury. Time will prove that we made the right choice.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "By then, you'll be history, and your reputation and status will have been long gone."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'But now, you have a chance...'}
{3: 'The person retrieves two kraft envelopes from their pocket.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'This is...?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "I know transport crafts are causing quite a headache for the World Government. After all, the military's air force is nearly decimated after the failure of the Great Transfer."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Everyone knows this planet is not safe anymore. The sky is the only refuge.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'You know quite a lot.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Kurono has many friends.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "So, I've brought you a little gift..."}
{3: 'He points at one of the envelopes.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'And a small proposal...'}
{3: 'He then points at the other envelope.'}
{3: 'Trillard opens the first envelope and discovers a transfer contract for the air transport service much needed by the World Government.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Where did you get so many transport crafts?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "It's not like we have to go to the front lines, all thanks to the World Government's protection of civilian property."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'I also have the right to requisition them in the name of the World Government.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "At a time like this? No, you're not gonna pour gasoline on the fire after such a major defeat."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Things on the front lines are tough, and the rear isn't any better. You wouldn't want people to get the wrong idea, would you?"}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Does the World Government still have enough manpower to handle riots?'}
{3: 'He silently opens the other envelope, revealing a list of names.'}
{3: 'After a mere glance at the first page, he sets the list aside.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "That's too many positions you're asking for.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "My friend, I'm a businessman. Getting to the bottom line of a deal is second nature to me, so don't even bother with your negotiation tactics."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Moreover, this isn't just a proposal; it's an invitation."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'An invitation?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'You know, there\'s this old saying: "A smart bird picks its perch, and a wise minister picks their ruler."'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'The era of the Science Council is over...'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "But I don't believe the next era belongs to you.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'If you sign the contract, it will belong to usâ€”not just me, but us.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "You'll still be the big-shot President dominating the world of politics, not some loser that everyone despises."}
{3: "The change in Trillard's expression doesn't escape Kurono-San's notice."}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Even if I were to agree, it's not possible to replace all these positions at once. The President's power has its limits.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Everything will follow the rules, just like our previous collaborations.'}
{3: 'Hearing this, Trillard narrows his eyes.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Your reach extends quite far.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Further than you think. In the face of calamity, not everyone is as stubborn as Hans.'}
{3: 'With that said, he chuckles softly.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "He's like an unwavering pine tree, refusing to bend even when all its leaves have fallen and its vitality has faded away."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "But most people are just like grass, swaying in whichever direction the wind blows. That's why we have quite a few potential allies on our side."}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'So, which category do you fall into?'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'I need a list of collaborators.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Of course, but...'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Considering our past unpleasant experiences with broken promises, I would like you to make a globally televised speech as the President first.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "You're essentially asking me to make it a fait accompli?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "What matters isn't what's promised but what's done, right?"}
{3: 'A profound silence blankets the space between the two.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'A list of names, a little bit of help...'}
{3: 'He slides the two envelopes across the table, presenting his bargaining chips to Trillard.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'And your next re-election.'}
{3: 'Trillard ponders for a moment before crossing out two names on the list.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "I can't meddle with the military; Hans has too much influence there.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Kurono-San frowns, waiting for him to continue.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "There's a press conference next month, and the appointment orders will be announced by then.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: "Hmm... Alright, those two aren't important anyway."}
{3: 'Kurono-San signs his name on the transfer contract.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Once the announcement is made, the transport crafts will be transferred to you directly.'}
{2: 'Kurono-San', 3: 'Also, welcome aboard, Trillard.'}
{3: 'The person rises to his feet, puts on his hat, and leaves the room.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{3: 'One month later.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: "A hard blow lands on Trillard's face, sending him tumbling to the ground."}
{3: 'In the span of a mere month, Hans appears to have aged by decades.'}
{3: 'The following day, as people in the command room see Hans with his hair turned white overnight, their eyes fill with concern and worry.'}
{3: 'Nevertheless, he only calmly waves his hand, signaling everyone to proceed with their work.'}
{3: 'If those soldiers have become bargaining chips for the future, then he will willingly place himself as a wager too.'}
{3: "He won't and can't dishonor the lives lost by succumbing to guilt and avoidance."}
{3: 'He will use himself as a bargaining chip wisely, letting it serve its purpose and die with dignity.'}
{3: "Clearly, finding an easy way out through suicide won't be a wise use of that."}
{3: "But he didn't expect someone to desert their ground already."}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'What the hell is going on?!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'When those councilors were thrown into prison on false charges, and when Trillard announced the new appointments at the press conference...'}
{3: 'Hans was consumed by an anger greater than ever. He never expected that Trillard would be the one to betray them first.'}
{1: '2', 2: 'Trillard', 3: 'Hans, we need those transport crafts.', 4: '2'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: "But you're overdrawing the future of the Parliament!", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'You know the consequences once the World Government falls into their hands.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Trillard stays silent for a long time before finally speaking.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "Hans, our dream is already shattered. It's time to face reality.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{3: 'Trillard is punched once more, and the bodyguard standing aside can no longer hold himself back, intervening to stop Hans.'}
{2: 'Bodyguard', 3: 'Sir, if you persist with this course of action, you will be perceived as assaulting the President.'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Do you have anything else to say to me?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Trillard remains silent.'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'Let go. I can walk on my own!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Hans turns to leave the room, with the door slammed shut behind him.'}
{1: 'DialogDisable'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{3: 'At night.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'After giving his final instructions, Trillard dismisses the young man in front of him.'}
{3: 'He retrieves some tools and starts meticulously cleaning this room where he has dedicated nearly twenty years of his life.'}
{3: 'He is being incredibly thorough, leaving no corner or shadow untouched.'}
{3: 'After sweeping away the dust from the floor, he proceeds to wipe the bookshelves...'}
{3: "It's not until all the windows gleam with clarity that he finally sinks back into his chair, gently rubbing his aching back."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Trillard', 3: "Phew... After the cleaning, it shouldn't get dirty again for a while.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'As he gazes at the moonlight streaming through the window, for some inexplicable reason, the memory of raising a toast with Hans floods his mind.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory46.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Trillard', 3: 'To tomorrow.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Hans', 3: 'To tomorrow.', 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'He never forgets the exhilaration of gazing at the stars; at that very moment, he realized that this was the cause he would dedicate his life to.'}
{3: 'He wants to lead humanity out of the solar system and continue writing their legend in the universe.'}
{3: 'He wants to leave a glorious mark on history instead of fading away into its annals of oblivion.'}
{3: 'He wants to explain to his best friend, to bid a dignified farewell.'}
{3: "But he can't..."}
{3: 'For that seemingly casual promise has always been his guiding creed.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory829.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Trillard', 3: "I can assure you, though, that I'm not being entirely selfish here. I've always placed the World Government above myself.", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The man, accustomed to wielding lies as his weapon, chooses to hide his true feelings even at the very end.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: "This age doesn't need another mediocre politician, but I can still do something for you.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'He pours out the long-prepared red wine and raises a toast to the moon.'}
{2: 'Trillard', 3: 'To tomorrow.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The red liquid in the glass is downed in one gulp.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory427.jpg'}
{3: "The following day, the Control Court received a comprehensive report, outlining the President of the World Government's crimes of corruption and bribery, accompanied by compelling evidence."}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '0.5'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory423.jpg'}
{3: "When the members of the Control Court broke into Trillard's office, they found him already dead."}
{3: 'The wine glass beside him tested positive for cyanide, consistent with the presumed cause of his death.'}
{3: 'Meanwhile, the evidence presented in the report was verified as authentic.'}
{3: 'Trillard was promptly expelled from the World Government, and those whom he had wronged were soon released and reinstated to their rightful positions.'}
{3: "The substantial assets under Trillard's name, of unknown origin, were all confiscated, including a significant number of transport crafts."}
{3: 'If Trillard were still alive, the masterminds behind the scene would have countless ways to coerce him into recanting and disclosing the identity of the anonymous report sender.'}
{3: 'But with his death, they could do nothing to a dead person despised by the whole world.'}
{3: 'That day, Hans locked himself in his office for a long time.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory3.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '0.5'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory3.jpg'}
{3: 'That day, the Purifying Force sprang into action, and Ballard nearly crushed the terminal in his hand as he saw the long list of names.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ballard', 3: 'Move out! Time to root out the tumors of corruption!', 4: '1'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory829.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory829.jpg'}
{3: "Trillard's scandal has ignited a worldwide uproar."}
{3: 'However, just three days later, no one pays attention to the dead former president anymore.'}
{3: 'The Acadia Evacuation...'}
{3: '...Is starting.'}
